Title: Discrimination
Text: We’re very sorry to hear you are experiencing stress due to discrimination or marginalization. We recognize that people have different needs following such experiences, so we want to offer a number of tools to help support you at this time.

Title: Discrimination
Text: Here are some tools and resources you might find helpful at this time. Please select one or more of the following options:
Items: Journal::I would like to write down my thoughts and feelings tied to this experience; Reporting:: Reporting - I would like to be provided with resources tied to reporting an instance of discrimination or harassment; Self-Care::Self-Care and Wellness - I would like to be provided with resources tied to self-care and wellness practices that may be helpful following an instance of discrimination, marginalization, or harassment.; Allyship::Allyship - I would like to be provided with resources tied to providing allyship and support to others who have experienced discrimination, marginalization, or harassment.; Community::Community support - I would like to be provided with resources tied to community-building and social support; Activism::Activism - I would like to be provided with resources tied to activism and empowerment; Mental Health (Emotional Support)::Mental Health (Emotional Support) - I would like to be provided with resources tied to receiving emotional support for my mental health; Disability Support:: Disability Support - I would like to be provided with resources tied to receiving support for my disability; Crisis Support for LGBTQ+ Youth::Crisis Support for LGBTQ+ Youth - I would like to receive crisis support tied to identifying as an LGBTQ+ young person; Training::I would like to complete a training session now to practice thinking flexibly in a different domain; ^NotMatched::These resources do not match what I am looking for at this time; ^NotNeeded::I am not looking for any additional resources at this time

Title: Journal
Text: Feel free to use the space below in any way that feels helpful for you:

Title: Reporting
Text:
ADA File a Complaint: Here's a step-by-step guide on how to file a complaint under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). https://www.ada.gov/file-a-complaint/

NAMI Guide: How do I file a complaint against a medical facility/provider? Learn how to file a complaint against a medical facility or provider with this NAMI guide. https://helplinefaqs.nami.org/article/99-how-do-i-file-a-complaint-against-a-medical-facility-provider

Title: Self-Care
Text: Wellness Tools from the Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective: Explore different ways that you can care for your emotional and mental health with these resources compiled by the Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective. https://beam.community/wellness-tools/

Title: Allyship
Text:
The Guide to Allyship: Interested in learning what it takes to be an effective ally? Here's a guide. https://guidetoallyship.com/

Talking About Race: Conversations about race are important — here's how you can do them right. https://nmaahc.si.edu/learn/talking-about-race

Guide to Being an LGBTQ+ Ally from the Human Rights Campaign: Have a look at this guide for providing allyship to the LGBTQ+ community from the Human Rights Campaign. https://reports.hrc.org/being-an-lgbtq-ally#showing-support-for-different-identities

Guide to Supporting LGBTQ+ Young People With Disabilities from the Trevor Project: Check out this comprehensive guide that talks about how to be an ally for LGBTQ+ youth with disabilities from the Trevor Project.https://www.thetrevorproject.org/wpcontent/uploads/2023/03/2024_Guide_Supporting-LGBTQ-Youth-With-Disabilities_V4.pdf

Title: Community
Text:
Parkinson's Buddy Network by Michael J. Fox Foundation: Join the PD community on an online platform hosted by the Michael J. Fox Foundation. To get started, sign up with your email. https://parkinsonsbuddynetwork.michaeljfox.org/v2/

\n\n\n\nPFLAG Local Chapter: Find a local chapter through PFLAG, an organization devoted to LGBTQ+ people and their families. Search for a chapter by entering your zip code or state. https://pflag.org/get-support/

Title: Activism
Text:
Disability and Access Resource from Showing Up for Racial Justice:Want to learn more about Disability Justice? These Google Docs from Showing Up for Racial Justice will teach you how to become a better disability activist.https://surj.org/resources/disability-and-access/

\n\n\n\nRespectability's LGBTQ+ People with Disabilities Resources: Learn more about the intersection of disability and LGBTQ+ identities. https://www.respectability.org/resources/lgbtq/

Title: Mental Health (Emotional Support)
Text: NAMI Helpline:Feeling down or struggling? You don’t have to go through it alone! The NAMI HelpLine connects you with a caring peer for support.https://www.nami.org/help

Title: Disability Support
Text:
Regional ADA Centers: Find your regional ADA center by clicking on your state in the map. Reach out by phone or email. https://adata.org/find-your-region

The American Association of People with Disabilities (AAPD): Check out the AAPD, which helps people with disabilities have equal rights and opportunities. https://www.aapd.com/

The Asian Americans with Disabilities Initiative (AADI): Join the AADI to connect with the community and help fight racism and ableism. https://www.aadinitiative.org/

Disability Rights Education & Defense Fund (DREDF): Want to see how DREDF helps fight for the rights of people with disabilities? Check them out here. https://dredf.org/

The National Disability Rights Network (NDRN): The National Disability Rights Network (NDRN) helps people with disabilities find local advocacy services in their state. https://www.ndrn.org/

Title: Crisis Support for LGBTQ+ Youth
Text: The Trevor Project's 24/7 Suicide Hotline for LGBTQ+ Youth:The Trevor Project is there 24/7 with free, confidential support for LGBTQIA+ young people in crisis.https://www.thetrevorproject.org/get-help/
Conditions: Discrimination; Crisis Support for LGBTQ+ Youth
